name: Steven Xie
blurb: I study CS at the University of Waterloo, and I aim to build things that matter.

experiences.title: Full-stack Developer @ ConsenSys
points: Developed a team management webapp using [[React]], [[MongoDB]], and [[Neo4J]], which aims to support the operation of decentralized organizations like ConsenSys.
Gained experience with solving problems related to relationship-focused data using [[graph databases]], and architecting scalable data-heavy applications using [[Redux]] and [[websockets]].
Gained experience working in a fast-paced startup environment, and learned about the importance of constant feedback when working in a team.

experiences.title: iOS App Developer @ Evichat Inc.
points: Designed and programmed Evichat's primary iOS client app in [[Swift 3]], which acted as the client entrypoint for Evichat's services
Implemented [[OAuth 1.0 and 2.0]] auth flows to integrate with social services like Gmail, Twitter, and Instagram.
Worked with [[CocoaPods]] to modularize the app into easy-to-maintain networking and UI components, which streamlined the development process.

experiences.title: Software Developer @ buildABILITY
points: Created a cross-platform automated certificate creator and sender using [[Electron]] and [[Node.js]] to automate a manual pdf-creation and emailing procedure.
Reduced a 90-minute manual procedure into a 30-second automated one (per batch of 100 clients), dramatically increasing operational efficiency.
Integrated with external APIs to read and write to CSVs, produce and rasterize PDFs, and send emails.

projects.name: express-starter
points: Developed a starter kit for [[Express]], [[Typescript]], and [[Docker]] in order to bootstrap web app development for myself and for friends wanting to start their own web development projects, but who were struggling with the setup.
The starter kit is fully documented, with beginner-friendly explanations on how Express routes are configured, and how to configure the Docker container build process.

projects.name: Elevate (Team Project)
points: Creating a game-based learning system in Unity to help people with autism spectrum disorder learn everyday life skills.
Developing an dashboard / analysis system in React and Python (Flask) to allow parents and teachers to track player progress and discover insights.

education.name: University of Waterloo
education.blurb: Candidate for a Bachelor's of Computer Science (BCS).

awards.title: Hack4Health Third Place Winner
points: Worked with a team to design and pitch Pilot, a cross-platform todo-based personal assistant with a simple interface, designed specifically to help people with dementia.
Designed a dementia-friendly interface on [[Sketch]], and prototyped with [[React Native]] and [[Expo]].
